title: Pupri (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Pupri (Vidhan Sabha constituency) was an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Sitamarhi%20district">Sitamarhi district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="Bihar">Bihar</a>. Nearest railway station is [Janakpur Road].
Overview.
It was part of <a href="Sitamarhi%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Sitamarhi (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
As a consequence of the orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission of India</a>, Pupri (Vidhan Sabha constituency) ceased to exist in 2010.
Election results.
1977-2005.
In the <a href="Bihar%20Assembly%20Election%2C%20Oct%202005">October 2005</a> and <a href="Bihar%20Assembly%20Election%2C%20Feb%202005">February 2005 state assembly elections</a>, Shahid Ali Khan of <a href="Janata%20Dal%20%28United%29">Janata Dal (United)</a> won the 72 Pupri assembly seat, defeating his nearest rivals, Ram Dulari Devi and <a href="Nawal%20Kishore%20Rai">Nawal Kishore Rai</a>, both of <a href="Rashtriya%20Janata%20Dal">Rashtriya Janata Dal</a>, in respective years. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. <a href="Sitaram%20Yadav">Sitaram Yadav</a> of RJD defeated Habib Ahmad Birari of JD(U) in 2000. <a href="Sitaram%20Yadav">Sitaram Yadav</a> representing <a href="Janata%20Dal">Janata Dal</a> defeated Ram Briksh Chaudhary representing <a href="Samata%20Party">Samata Party</a> in 1995 and representing <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1990. Ram Briksh Chaudhary of Congress defeated <a href="Sitaram%20Yadav">Sitaram Yadav</a> of <a href="Lok%20Dal">Lok Dal</a> in 1985 and Sudama Devi of Congress in 1980. Habib Ahmad Birari of <a href="Janata%20Party">Janata Party</a> defeated Ram Briksh Chaudhary of Congress in 1977.
